terms.definition: Robot Operating System 2 - A set of software libraries and tools for building robot applications. ROS 2 provides hardware abstraction, device drivers, communication middleware, and common functionality.
A process that performs computation in ROS 2. Nodes communicate with each other using topics, services, and actions.
A named bus over which nodes exchange messages in a publish-subscribe pattern. Topics are used for continuous data streams.
A request-reply communication pattern in ROS 2. Services are used when you need a response to a request.
A communication pattern for long-running tasks that provides feedback during execution and can be cancelled.
A named configuration value that can be set at node startup or changed dynamically at runtime.
Unified Robot Description Format - An XML format for representing a robot model, including links, joints, and visual/collision geometry.
Simulation Description Format - An XML format that describes objects and environments for robot simulators, used primarily by Gazebo.
A virtual representation of a physical robot or system that mirrors its real-world counterpart and can be used for simulation, testing, and monitoring.
An open-source 3D robotics simulator that integrates with ROS 2 for physics simulation, sensor simulation, and robot control testing.
NVIDIA's robotics simulation platform built on Omniverse, offering photorealistic rendering, physics simulation, and synthetic data generation.
NVIDIA's synthetic data generation tool that creates labeled training data for computer vision and machine learning models.
NVIDIA's hardware-accelerated ROS 2 packages optimized for NVIDIA Jetson and GPU platforms.
Vision-Language-Action - A class of AI models that combine visual perception, natural language understanding, and action generation for robot control.
Vision-Language Model - An AI model that can understand and reason about both images and text, often used for scene understanding in robotics.
AI systems that interact with the physical world through a robotic body, combining perception, reasoning, and action.
A machine learning approach where a robot learns to perform tasks by observing and mimicking expert demonstrations.
Data Distribution Service - The communication middleware standard used by ROS 2 for reliable, real-time data exchange between nodes.
Quality of Service - Policies in ROS 2 that control the reliability, durability, and timing of message delivery between nodes.
Transform library in ROS 2 that tracks coordinate frames over time and enables transformation of data between different reference frames.
